creator: tgr@spoiled.org
text:
it took me about two hours to find out why my ldap-auth via mod_auth_ldap with
its "require group" statement does not work :o) -> the reason was, that the
argument to "require group" (i.e. the dn of the group) should not be written
within '"' as stated in the mod_auth_ldap documentation which comes with apache
httpd 2.0.47 ... after removing the '"' everything worked fine ... tested it on
win2k (apache httpd) against the ldap interface of a win2k ads and on linux
(apache httpd) against an iplanet 5.1sp1 directoryserver running on solaris ...
maybe the same holds true for the other options too (require dn?) ... maybe it
should be updated in the docs if my observation is correct

a lot of thanks in advance and keep up that good work - best wishes

  thomas graichen

creator: urkle@outoforder.cc
text:
confirmed..,
There should be no "'s around the group name.. I just ran into this problem
myself..And the thing is I had the same problem when using auth_ldap for apache
1.3 and forgot that I had already went through this debugging session to figure
out I needed to remove the "'s..  

Please update the documentation accordingly..
Regards.
